Text.Value: Rambling garbage. Typical.
Nothing in these notes but nonsensical run-on sentences.
Can't make heads nor tails of this.
The ravings of a lunatic. Pure nonsense.
This gibberish is giving me a headache.
'Protector'? 'Magma'? Doesn't make a lick of sense.
A bunch of gibberish, as far as I can tell.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |Just reading through this gibberish causes a headache! Nothing but madness.|

Text.Value: Pity it's so light on details, mind. Mad gibberish...
The reference to a 'hot hammer' is rather puzzling though. Whoever wrote these papers must have been rather delirious.
Pity I can't make heads nor tails of the rest of it.
But what of this 'hot hammer'? The author was surely mad.
There's more written here... no, must be gibberish.
Can't say I understand this bit about a 'hot hammer', though.
Too bad the rest of the note is pure gibberish.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |But the rest is just gibberish.| (copy of Speaker_2 variant)

Text.Value: A hidden adamantine forge? Imagine the blades you could produce with that.
These papers describe an adamantine forge hidden somewhere deep below. Such a forge is a treasure vault where the treasure's for the making.
Something about an adamantine forge hidden here. Amazing.
An adamantine forge? Imagine the blades gith artisans might craft with such a device.
These notes speak of an adamantine forge hidden deep below.
An adamantine forge, hidden deep in the Underdark - the stuff of legends.
According to these notes, there's an adamantine forge down here.

EditorData.logicalname: Doesn't know about the forge, 2nd speaker avail.

Text.Value: There is a guardian to take care of, of course. But all I need is a... 'hot hammer'?
An adamantine forge is very much a treasure, and any good treasure is protected by a guardian. Looks like we can defeat it with a so-called 'hot hammer'.
Interesting. Whatever's guarding the forge, a 'hot hammer' can crack it.
It boasts a 'protector' of some sort, something weak to a 'hot hammer'.
Seems it's got a protector... one vulnerable to a 'hot hammer', whatever that is.
This 'protector' sounds weak to extreme heat. Something to keep in mind.
A protector is guarding it, if I'm reading this right. And this 'hot hammer' is key to its downfall.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |So much madness here ... But there is some sense between the lines. The"protector of the forge" - whoever it is - is only vulnerable when heated.| (copy of Speaker_2 variant)

Text.Value: I would've appreciated more details, personally. The rest of the note reads like gibberish.
The reference to a 'hot hammer' is rather puzzling though. Whoever wrote these papers must have been rather delirious.
Can't make heads nor tails of the rest of it.
But what is this nonsense about a 'hot hammer'? Mad ravings, surely.
There's more written about it... scrawled, more like. I can't figure it out.
But what's this about a 'hot hammer'? Doesn't make a lick of sense.
The rest of the note is pure gibberish, as far as I can tell.
There is a guardian to take care of, of course. But all we need is a... 'hot hammer'?
An adamantine forge is very much a treasure, and any good treasure is protected by a guardian. Looks like we can defeat it with a so-called 'hot hammer'.
And whatever's protecting it can be cracked by a 'hot hammer'. What a story.
Seems it is closely guarded. And this so-called 'hot hammer' is key to its destruction.
Something's guarding it... something vulnerable to a 'hot hammer', whatever that is.
'Only in magma destroyed'. Whatever's protecting it, it'll take some fierce heat to crack it.
Seems it's guarded by a protector of some sort - something weak to this 'hot hammer'.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |So much madness here ... But there is some sense between the lines. The"protector of the forge" - whoever it is - is only vulnerable when heated.|

Text.Value: The forge has a guardian undone by heat and hammer. Sounds simple...
What have we here? Adamantine forge... Mysterious guardian... Mention of a 'hot hammer'...  A whole adventure in a nutshell.
Interesting. Whatever's guarding the forge, a 'hot hammer' can crack it.
The adamantine forge is guarded. And this so-called 'hot hammer' is key to its destruction.
The forge is guarded by something vulnerable to a 'hot hammer'. Might be useful - or gibberish.
'Only in magma destroyed'. Whatever's protecting that forge, it'll take some fierce heat to crack it.
Something's guarding that forge - and it's weak to this 'hot hammer'.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: |Words of a madman ... But there is some sense between the lines. The"protector of the forge" - whoever it is - is only vulnerable when heated.|

Synopsis: The party comments on reading and attempting to decipher the records of the mad drow wizard, who was one of the three looking for the Adamantine Forge.The records mention a group who located the Adamantine Forge, laying somewhere in the depth of the Underdark, and barely survived the undefeatable protector who guarded it - the adamantine golem, who has one weakness - being heated and struck by a huge forge hammer.
